meanings.definition: The position or office of a chief.
meanings.sent1: In the tribe, the chiefship was passed down from father to son.
meanings.sent2: The chiefship of the company was a prestigious role with many responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The chiefship of the school's chess club was unexpectedly won by a first grader.
meanings.sent4: She aspired to reach the chiefship of the organization and lead with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The chiefship of the pirate crew was up for grabs after the captain's retirement.

meanings.definition: The authority or leadership of a chief.
meanings.sent1: His chiefship was unquestioned among the members of the council.
meanings.sent2: The chiefship of the team ensured that decisions were made efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cat hilariously assumed the chiefship of the household, demanding treats all day.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the chiefship of a queen, commanding respect from all around her.
meanings.sent5: The chiefship of the forest animals belonged to the wise old owl, guiding them through challenges.
